author: barnabasbusa
content:
hey everyone! We have Image builder repo with [branches.yaml](https://github.com/ethpandaops/eth-client-docker-image-builder/blob/master/branches.yaml). 
Would be good if you have a branch that you would like to build frequently (for devnet purpose) to make a pr to this yaml file, then it will automatically be picked up.

author: barnabasbusa
content: I'm keeping an eye on the repo and will merge in any PRs that are coming in. Its just a lot easier to have you guys submit the PRs than me trying to collect all the branch names individually, and keeping up when you merge a branch into master for example.

author: barnabasbusa
content:
Feel free to add/remove branches that you need/do not need anymore. 
The automatic image builder gets triggered 1x an hour, so if you make multiple commits within an hour, it might not get included.

author: ethdreamer
content: The epoch processing tests aimed at testing `process_proposer_lookahead()` are broken so you won't pass those. Instead of just running `process_epoch()`, it runs a whole epoch's worth of blocks and state transitions.

content: WTF?

author: potuz
content: I can't merge my PR without these tests

content: Why did this happen, the tests should be exactly the same as previous forks

author: ethdreamer

content: Nah I can't hack the test runner. <@592004585506340885> this is a blocker for Prysm, can we cook alpha2?

content: It should literally be just removing this test and enabling the usual one

author: linoscope
content:
Ah, my bad. I assume the way I yield the values [here](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/33e18203797dde473b6a4ca7bd1619fd27078cd1/tests/core/pyspec/eth2spec/test/fulu/epoch_processing/test_process_proposer_lookahead.py#L17) is wrong?
```
    # Run epoch processing
    yield "pre", state
    next_epoch(spec, state)
    yield "post", state
```

author: linoscope
content: These are new tests added to the PR

author: potuz
content: but I think you don't need to write a new one

author: potuz
content: you just enable the previous tests that compare the states.

author: potuz
content: for epoch processing we should already have those

author: linoscope
content: Oh, I see.

author: potuz
content: ah but no you are making a specific new assertion

author: linoscope
content: So just remove the yields from the above tests?

author: potuz
content: yeah you'd need a special test

author: potuz
content: if you want to make the specific assertion that you make there that the proposers were shifted, you'd want to do that

author: ethdreamer
content: if we do `alpha.2` then we could use the opportunity to fix those two return values to `Vector` instead of `List`

author: potuz
content: however I think you should also make an assertion that the proposer at slot 0 is actually the proposer that would get computed

author: potuz
content: I don't think you need to make the tests return vectors instead of lists, for python types it's fine to use lists, the difference is only on SSZ

author: ethdreamer
content: He did. He just ran `next_epoch()` instead of `run_epoch_processing_with()`

author: potuz
content: <@911437720994324570> I think in addition to the assertion you want to add one that checks that the proposers are right

author: potuz
content: not only that they match with the prestate

author: potuz
content: the reason being that the shifting is trivial and unlikely to have bugs, but the computation itself may be wrong in our codebase and this would not catch it

author: jtraglia
content: Yeah this is my fault too, didn't catch the issue. Made this PR: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/4364

author: linoscope
content: Thank you!

author: potuz
content: added the same above comment to the PR

author: jtraglia
content: I don't entirely understand your comment. What do you mean?

author: potuz
content:
So there are two things that we do on epoch processing: we compute the next epoch and we shift the lookahead. This PR checks that the lookahead is being shifted but not that the computation was carried out correctly. 

As an addendum, the assert assumes that MinSeedLookahead = 1, it should change to the general case

author: linoscope
content:
Something like this?
* We precompute lookahead in beacon state. Cache this as `proposer_lookahead`
* Epoch transition.
* Check that current proposer at start of epoch is `proposer_lookahead[SLOTS_PER_EPOCH + 1]`

author: jtraglia
content: I think you're missing the 2nd assert.

author: potuz
content: yeah, or just after the transition check that compute_proposer_index for slot `SLOTS_PER_EPOCH + 1` equals what we have in the lookahead

content: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/30e2ff3a25f406b085925b49131bdb2494f7c7f2/tests/core/pyspec/eth2spec/test/fulu/epoch_processing/test_process_proposer_lookahead.py#L29-L31

author: linoscope
content:
For checks that the "cached" lookahead matches the computed lookahead, we also have
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/33e18203797dde473b6a4ca7bd1619fd27078cd1/tests/core/pyspec/eth2spec/test/fulu/fork/test_fork_lookahead_consistency.py#L21-L22

And
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/33e18203797dde473b6a4ca7bd1619fd27078cd1/tests/core/pyspec/eth2spec/test/fulu/epoch_processing/test_process_proposer_lookahead.py#L26-L27
